result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew O Salami was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation today. Probation agent can petition court for early release after 1 1/2 years.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

NO illegal substances. 

If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. Cannot vote. Cannot hold elective office. Other civil rights may be lost until restored.

timeConds.notes: Subject to work release. Not subject to good time.

superMiscConds.notes: May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

No alcohol.
No controlled substances unless prescribed.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must follow programming recommended by DOC.
Must follow all rules of supervision. 
All outstanding financial obligations to be paid through the Department of Corrections while incarcerated or on extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept and subject to collection efforts.

CASES: 12CF328, 15CF11 & 17CF201. Defendant Matthew O Salami in court with attorney Dan Firkus.  Defendant Matthew O Salami in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 2:37 pm.  CT finds elig for CIP & SA pgm.
12CF328-Count 1-5 yr, 2 yr IC & 3 yr ES, 634 days credit.   Follow programming, no alcohol, no controlled substances unless prescribed.  Follow rules of supervision. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

CASES:  13CF344, 14CF38, 15CF11 & 15CF12.  Defendant Matthew O Salami in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Defendant Matthew O Salami in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 11:47 am  Amended info to be filed.  Def waives new PSI.  

13CF344 - Def plea of G as to amended Ct 2 & Ct 4.  CT accepts plea, finds Def G, enters JOC as to Ct 2 & Ct 4.  Cts 1, 3, 5 - DRI.

15CF11 - Def plea of G as to amended Ct 1. CT accepts plea, finds Def G as to Ct 1, does not enter JOC due to DJOC.  Cts 2 & 3 - Dismissed.

15CF12 - Def plea of G as to amended Ct 1. CT accepts plea, finds Def G as to Ct 1, does not enter JOC due to DJOC.  Cts 2 & 3 - Dismissed.

Terms of DJOC on 15CF11 & 15CF12:  5 yrs, bound by all non-monetary cond of bond.  $150.00 DJOC fee on each, 60 dtp.  

14CF38 - DRI

All uncharged matters will not be charged.

SENTENCING as to 13CF344
Ct 2:  w/h sent, 3 yr prob, concurrent w/any current prob, restitution incl of surch-to be broke down on JOC-for $3226.19, j/s w/Jasmine Taylor & Maclaine Stener.  Apology ltrs to all victims.  30 days in jail, consec to any conditional time currently sitting.  $290.60 fine.   No DNA surch.  

Ct 4:  w/h sent.  1 yr prob, concurrent w/any current prob.  9 mos banked to be used by probation as necessary.  $265.60 fine.  

PP on both Cts of $25.00/mo due on 4/1/15, & on the 1st day of each month thereafter.  

If all cond of prob have been met, elig for expun on Felony I & H.  12:21 pm adj.
State's - Submitted by ADA Tolan.
